intro: Polygala hagerupii, commonly known as the Hagerup's milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, delicate flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its flowers are usually pale pink or white, and it produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
